name: Hampton Inn & Suites Red Bluff

reviews.text: Wonderful stay! I loved the Hampton breakfast and the overall lobby. The train was a little annoying, but you can't blame the hotel for that :)
reviews.title: Hampton!!!

reviews.text: The beds were so comfortable! I fell asleep as soon as I hit the pillow. Nice high ceilings too.
reviews.title: Another great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a bit of trouble with the door slamming, but I called the manager and they sent up someone right away to fix it :)
reviews.title: Comfortable stay in nice King studio suite

likes.liked: — The nice suite and friendly staff

reviews.title: Comfy Beds
reviews.text: We absolutely love this hotel. We have family in Red Bluff and this is the only place to stay as far as we're concerned. We always stay on the third floor and have never had an issue with noise. Yes, there are those rude travelers who don't care if their doors slam shut or if their kids run and scream down the halls but that has nothing to do with the hotel itself. This time my ten year old daughter made friends with the girl in charge of doing breakfast. She let my daughter choose the breakfast that was served every day we were there (6 days total). She thought that was great. Everyone is friendly. The rooms are nice. This Hampton Inn is much better than most. Would definately recommend.

Near the front desk is a huge beautiful wooden carved panel with cowboy figures. Also around the breakfast area are some smaller wooden panels. I find it always very nice if a hotel has a local touch. At the front desk was a friendly girl and check-in went smooth. We were given an upgrade to a King studio because of our Diamond HHonors status.
reviews.title: Consistent excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We called for a reservation late in the afternoon and talked to Elizabeth about availability of a quiet room as we had read about the "train" noise. She was very professional and said she had rooms on the "quiet side" of the building. When we got there she lowered our quoted rate as we had not told her about being AAA members. After a long day on the road it was wonderful to be met by such a friendly and helpful person at the desk.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Choice

reviews.text: We found the hotel to be spotless and looked to be quite new. The room had very nice amenities, a very comfortable bed, a large bathroom and a "solid" tub and shower. The breakfast was pretty standard with two hot items, cheese omlet and sausage patties. The breakfast are is a two story atrium which really adds a nice feeling.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We had no neighbors so cannot comment on how quiet the rooms are from that aspect. As you walked down the hall you could hear people talking in their rooms so this might be an issue if the hotel was full.
reviews.title: loud and noisy
Noisy, Super-Thin Walls, Won't Return
reviews.text: The facility is right on I-5 but north of town where most of the restaurants are located. We walked to a wonderful mexican restaurant that is about 1/2 block away and had a great meal.
Regarding trains. There is a main RR line about 1/2 block away from the front of the hotel. We were in the rear and never heard a thing so ask for a room on that side and you will be fine.
reviews.title: Excellant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at a Hampton Inn before, but that was about 15 years ago so I will consider this my first stay.
reviews.title: More than I expected.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay coincided with the huge, annual Red Bluff Roundup rodeo and I'm sure this had an effect on pricing (in a negative way), and possibly service (in a positive way.) Without a doubt every room was booked and the hotel was packed full.
reviews.title: An outstanding hotel

reviews.text: Everything looked brand new inside and out. Extremely clean and well maintained. I enjoyed the decor with the random pictures theme that also carried over into the rooms. The lobby was medium to large sized with leather couches, a flat screen TV, and free coffee choices. There was a personalized letter in our room welcoming us. We also received a call from the front desk about 15 minutes after entering our room to confirm everything was satisfactory. The free WiFi worked great. The beds were extremely comfortable as were the pillows, and the linens were spotless. Nice selection of channels on the TV. We were facing the front of the hotel and the curtains did an excellent job at blocking out the external lighting. Considering the amount of people in the hotel I was satisfied with the level of sound, which is almost nothing. We could not hear any sounds from neighboring rooms. We could see the train tracks from our room, and yes trains did go by, but the sound was not loud enough for us to consider it a problem.
reviews.title: Perfect.

reviews.text: Nitpicks would include a very loud fan on the HVAC system, and a less than perfect shower head.
reviews.title: Overall, Not Bad

reviews.text: This is an impressive hotel and we would stay again.
reviews.title: Just what I needed

reviews.text: The room and hotel was clean, service was fine and on-site breakfast allowed an easy morning before our drive into Lassen Volcanic National Park. The wall insulation between rooms was a bit thin as I could hear the next door TV until around midnight. It was hard to tell if the room thermostat was operating correctly. The thermostat was set to 72 degrees; however, the AC and fan (set to auto) was running all night as the room didn't seem to cool beyond 73 degrees. The fan noise somewhat masked the TV sound from the next room.
reviews.title: OK stay at Red Bluff Hampton Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're looking for a room that is away from train and traffic noise, I recommend a third floor location, facing the field.
reviews.title: Good place to stay!

reviews.text: This is a reasonably priced quality place to stay, with easy access from Interstate 5. Rooms nicely decorated, very comfortable beds, everything clean. Refrigerator and microwave in room, along with desk and chair, free wifi and ethernet. Free parking, with special parking for RVs and trailers. Hot breakfast consisted of bacon and scrambled eggs, plus make your own waffles, bagels, toast, muffins. The breakfast room staff are very attentive, and everything was kept well supplied and clean. There is an outside pool, so try to get a room that doesn't look over the pool, it gets very noisy in warm weather. Will definitely keep come back.
reviews.title: Nicest Folks in Red Bluff

reviews.text: To start with, this was an award stay and the hotel bumped me up to a suite so my family would have plenty of room. Very nice. When we checked in, the poor lady at the desk had just hurt here hamstring quite badly minutes before, and was trying to find a replacement to come in to replace her. Despite this, she was cheerful, helpful and recommended a fantastic restaurant on the river. The hotel was busy, and she managed everyone despite the evident pain she was in. I wish I remember her name, as she should get a raise. They had fresh baked cookies out front. The pool area was quite nice, and had nice oaks all around it. My kids enjoyed that. Breakfast was busy, but the food was fince and staff handled the large crowd well. Rooms are nice, quiet and I had no problems with noise.
reviews.title: Can't beat it

reviews.text: Red Bluff is a quaint town, with a literal Main Street. Much more interesting than Redding. For a little over $100, we had a two queen bed suite with a sitting area and a bar area with mini-fridge and microwave. The room was large compared to other places we have stayed with the same amenities. Super clean and comfortable. Fresh baked cookies at night. Friendly staff. About an 1 and 15 minutes from Lassen Volcanic National Park.
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise!

aka: Hampton Inn & Suites Red Bluff Hotel Red Bluff
